sen.j: 西園寺 公宣（さいおんじ きんのぶ、寛永2年（1625年） - 寛文10年8月15日 (旧暦)（1670年9月28日））は、江戸時代前期の公家。
sen.e: Kinnobu SAIONJI (1625 - September 28, 1670) was Kuge (court noble) in the early Edo period.
Kinnobu SAIONJI (1625 - September 28, 1670) was Kuge (a Court Noble) in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: court noble→a Court Nobleに訂正しました。
sen.e: Kinnobu SAIONJI (1625 - September 28, 1670) was Kuge (a Court Noble) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 別名は西園寺随宜とも言う。
sen.e: He was also called 西園寺随宜.
He was also called 西園寺随宜.
He was also called 西園寺随宜.

sen.j: 霊元天皇（111代）の代に仕えたが、母の死去後すぐに宮仕えを辞去している。
sen.e: He served the Imperial Court in the reign of Emperor Reigen, however, he resigned the service of the court shortly after the death of his mother.
He served for the sovereign of the 111th Emperor; However, he resigned the service shortly after his mother had died.
sen.cmt: served the Imperial Court in the reign of→served for the sovereign ofに訂正しました。of the court を削除しました。shortly after the death of his mother→shortly after his mother had diedに訂正しました。
sen.e: He served for the sovereign of the 111th Emperor; However, he resigned the service shortly after his mother had died.

sen.j: 父は左大臣西園寺実晴。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin Saneharu SAIONJI.
His father was Sadaijin Saneharu SAIONJI.
His father was Sadaijin Saneharu SAIONJI.

sen.j: 母は実晴室・細川忠隆の娘の徳。
sen.e: His mother, Toku was a wife of Saneharu and a daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.
His mother was Toku who was a wife of Saneharu, who was also a daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: His mother was Toku who was a wife of Saneharu, who was also a daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 年上の甥である中納言西園寺実尚が若くして急死したため、その後を受けて西園寺家を相続した。
sen.e: Since his older nephew, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Sanenao SAIONJI suddenly died at an early age, he succeeded to the SAIONJI family after him.
Since his older nephew, Sanenao SAIONJI who was Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) died young suddenly, he became heir to the SAIONJI family after Sanenao's death.
sen.cmt: who wasを追加しました。役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。suddenly died at an early age→died young suddenlyに訂正しました。succeeded to→became heir toに訂正しました。after him（誤訳です）→Sanenao's deathに訂正しました。
sen.e: Since his older nephew, Sanenao SAIONJI who was Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) died young suddenly, he became heir to the SAIONJI family after Sanenao's death.

sen.j: 従五位侍従に就任したが、寛文5年（1665年）に急に職を辞して隠居した。
sen.e: He took office as Jugoi Jiju (Junior Fifth Rank, Chamberlain), however, he suddenly resigned the post and retired in 1655.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He took the position of "Jugoi Jiju" (Junior Fifth Rank and Chamberlain); However, he suddenly resigned the position to go into retirement in 1655.
sen.cmt: took office→took the position, 役職に""とandを追加しました。Post→positionに訂正し、in 1655を移動しました。Retired→to go into retirementに訂正しました。
sen.e: He took the position of "Jugoi Jiju" (Junior Fifth Rank and Chamberlain); However, he suddenly resigned the position to go into retirement in 1655.

sen.j: そして、叔父にあたる細川内膳家長岡忠春を頼って肥後国入道水村（現在の熊本県菊陽町）に下向、そこで暮らしていたが病を得て寛文10年に45歳で卒去した。
sen.e: And, he went down to 入道水村, Higo Province (current Kikuyocho, Kumamoto province) to turn to his uncle, Tadaharu NAGAOKA of the Hosokawa-naizen family and lived there, however, he became sick and died at the age of 45 in 1670.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 入道水村：読み方不明
sen.e: Then, he moved to 入道水村 in Higo Province (the present Kikuyocho in Kumamoto province) to depend on his uncle, Tadaharu NAGAOKA who was a member of the Hosokawa-naizen family; After a while he settled there, he suffered from illness, which killed him at the age of 45 in 1670.
sen.cmt: And→then, went down→moved, turn to→depend onに訂正しました。村とProvinceの間にinを追加しました。Who was a member ofを追加しました。After a while he settledに訂正しました。Became sick→suffered from illness, and died→, which killed himに追加しました。
sen.e: Then, he moved to 入道水村 in Higo Province (the present Kikuyocho in Kumamoto province) to depend on his uncle, Tadaharu NAGAOKA who was a member of the Hosokawa-naizen family; After a while he settled there, he suffered from illness, which killed him at the age of 45 in 1670.

sen.j: 西園寺家は兄の西園寺公遂が継いだ。
sen.e: His brother, Kinsui SAIONJI succeeded to the Saionji family.
His brother, Kinsui SAIONJI became heir to the Saionji family.
sen.cmt: succeeded to→became heir toに訂正しました。
sen.e: His brother, Kinsui SAIONJI became heir to the Saionji family.

sen.j: 実は、西園寺公宣の肥後滞在中に、娘・安姫が生まれている。
sen.e: Actually, while Kinnobu SAIONJI stayed in Higo province, his daughter, Yasuhime was born.
In fact, when Kinnobu SAIONJI stayed in Higo province, he got a daughter, who was named Yasuhime.
sen.cmt: Actually→In factに訂正しました。while→whenに、his daughter, Yasuhime was born→he got a daughter, who was named Yasuhimeに訂正しました。
sen.e: In fact, when Kinnobu SAIONJI stayed in Higo province, he got a daughter, who was named Yasuhime.

sen.j: 公宣の死後、京都から迎えが来て安姫は西園寺家で育てられ、後に鷹司家から婿（西園寺実輔）をとって西園寺家を継ぐことになる。
sen.e: After the death of Kinnobu, Yasuhime was fetched by envoy from Kyoto and brought up in the Saionji family, and later, she took a husband from Takatsukasa family (Sanesuke SAIONJI) and succeeded to the Saionji Family.

After Kinnobu died, Yasuhime was collected by a messenger from the Imperial Court in Kyoto; She was brought up in the Saionji family; Later, she practically succeeded to the Saionji Family by getting a husband from the Takatsukasa family, who was Sanesuke SAIONJI, although he was regarded as just a formal heir.
sen.cmt: 全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: After Kinnobu died, Yasuhime was collected by a messenger from the Imperial Court in Kyoto; she was brought up in the Saionji family; later, she practically succeeded to the Saionji Family by getting a husband from the Takatsukasa family, who became Sanesuke SAIONJI, although he was regarded as just a formal heir.

sen.j: 熊本県の古閑原西端から北に農道を登った芳ケ平に、そこで死去した西園寺随宜を祀る神社と墓が残っている。
sen.e: In Yoshigadaira that you can get to by going up the farm road to the north from the western edge of Kogabaru in Kumamoto prefecture, there is a shrine and grave enshrine 西園寺随宜 who died there.

The shrine to honor 随宜Saionji and his tomb still remain at Yoshigadaira where he died; Yoshigadaira is located on the top of the farm road which is directed north from the west side of Kogabaru in Kumamoto prefecture.
sen.cmt: 熊本県の古閑原西端から北に農道を登った芳ケ平の表現を修正しました。
sen.e: The shrine to honor 西園寺随宜 and his tomb still remain at Yoshigadaira where he died; Yoshigadaira can be reached by going up a farm road to the north from the west side of Kogabaru in Kumamoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 随宜Saionji→西園寺随宜（前列においてもこのような表記にしているため）prefecture→Prefecturethe farm road→a farm road
